remarks.para: The displays Web-like links to child tables. You can click on a link to navigate to the child table. When a child table is displayed, a back button appears in the caption that can be clicked to navigate back to the parent table. The data from the parent rows is displayed below the caption and above the column headers. You can hide the parent row information by clicking the button to the right of the back button.
To display a table in the at run time, use the method to set the and properties to a valid data source. The following data sources are valid:

item.para: Any component that implements the interface
Any component that implements the interface

remarks.para: For more information about the class, see [<topic://cpconCreatingUsingDataSets>].
You can create a grid that enables users to edit data but prevents them from adding new rows by using a as the data source and setting the property to false.

Data sources are further managed by objects. For each table in a data source, a can be returned from the form's . For example, you can determine the number of rows contained by a data source by returning the associated object's property.
To validate data, use the underlying objects that represent data and their events. For example, if the data comes from a in a , use the and events.

block.para: Because the number of columns can be customized (by adding or deleting members of the ) and the rows can be sorted by column, the and property values cannot be guaranteed to correspond to and indexes in a . Therefore you should avoid using those properties in the event to validate data.

remarks.para: To determine which cell is selected, use the property. Change the value of any cell by using the property, which can take either the row and column indexes of the cell, or a single . Monitor the event to detect when the user selects another cell.
To determine which part of the control the user clicked, use the method in the event. The method returns a object, which contains the row and column of a clicked area.
To manage the appearance of the control at run time, several properties for setting the color and caption attributes are available, including the , , , and so on.

The appearance of the displayed grid (or grids) can be further modified by creating objects and adding them to the , which is accessed through the property. For example, if the is set to a containing three objects, you can add three objects to the collection, one for each table. To synchronize each object with a , set the of the to the of the . For more information about binding to an array of objects, see the property.

To create a customized view of a table, create an instance of a or class and add the object to the accessed through the property. Both classes inherit from . For each column style, set the to the of a column that you want to show in the grid. To hide a column, set its to something other than a valid .
To format the text of a column, set the property of the to one of the values found in Formatting Types and Custom DateTime Format Strings.

To bind the to a strongly typed array of objects, the object type must contain public properties. To create a that displays the array, set the property to where is replaced by the name of the object type. Also note that the property is case-sensitive; the type name must be matched exactly. See the property for an example.

You can also bind the to an . A feature of the is that it can contain objects of multiple types, but the can only bind to such a list when all items in the list are of the same type as the first item. This means that all objects must either be of the same type, or they must inherit from the same class as the first item in the list. For example, if the first item in a list is a , the second item could be a (which inherits from ). If, on the other hand, the first item is a , the second object cannot be a . Further, the must have items in it when it is bound. An empty will result in an empty grid. In addition, the objects in the must contain public properties. When binding to an , set the of the to "ArrayList" (the type name).

For each , you can set color and caption attributes that override the settings for the control. However, if those properties are not set, the settings for the control are used by default. The following properties can be overridden by properties:

To customize the appearance of individual columns, add objects to the , which is accessed through the property of each . To synchronize each with a in the , set the to the of a . When constructing a , you can also set a formatting string that specifies how the column displays data. For example, you can specify that the column use a short-date format to display dates contained in the table.

block.para: Always create objects and add them to the before adding objects to the . When you add an empty with a valid value to the collection, objects are automatically generated for you. Consequently, an exception will be thrown if you try to add new objects with duplicate values to the .

The control replaces and adds functionality to the control; however, the control is retained for both backward compatibility and future use, if you choose. For more information, see Differences Between the Windows Forms DataGridView and DataGrid Controls.

summary.para: Displays ADO.NET data in a scrollable grid. The control replaces and adds functionality to the control; however, the control is retained for both backward compatibility and future use, if you choose.

remarks.para: To populate a newly created control, set the property to a valid source, such as a , , or .

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.para: If this property is set to false, links to child tables are not shown.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether navigation is allowed.

remarks.para: If the property is set to false, then no links to child tables are shown.
For more information about handling events, see [<topic://cpconEventsOverview>].

summary.para: Occurs when the property has changed.

remarks.para: This property is overridden by the property if there is a currently in effect for the control.
If sorting is allowed, clicking on a column header will sort the table data by that column.
You can also sort using an expression for a . See for details on creating a sort expression.
If the is bound to a , you can set a custom sort for the table using the class's property. Similarly, if the is bound to a , each table in the can have a custom sort by setting the class's property.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the grid can be resorted by clicking on a column header.

remarks.para: By default, both the and the properties are set to the same color. Setting the property affects only even-numbered rows, while setting the affects only odd-numbered rows.

summary.para: Gets or sets the background color of odd-numbered rows of the grid.

remarks.para: The Back button becomes visible when a child table is displayed. Clicking the button will cause the grid to display the parent table.

summary.para: Occurs when the Back button on a child table is clicked.

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Drawing.Color BackColor { set; get; }

remarks.para: Whereas the property determines the color of rows in the grid, the determines the color of the nonrow area, which is only visible when the grid is scrolled to the bottom, or if only a few rows are contained in the grid.
By default, both the and the properties are set to the same color. Setting the property affects only even-numbered rows, while setting the affects only odd-numbered rows.

summary.para: Gets or sets the background color of even-numbered rows of the grid.

remarks.para: The determines the color of the nonrow area of the grid, which is only visible when no table is displayed by the , or if the grid is scrolled to the bottom, or if only a few rows are contained in the grid.

summary.para: Gets or sets the color of the non-row area of the grid.

remarks.para: For more information about handling events, see [<topic://cpconEventsOverview>].

summary.para: Occurs when the has changed.

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Drawing.Image BackgroundImage { set; get; }

summary.para: This member is not meaningful for this control.

remarks.para: The property is not meaningful for this control, although you can change its value and handle the event to detect the change.

summary.para: Occurs when the value of the property changes.

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Windows.Forms.ImageLayout BackgroundImageLayout { set; get; }

summary.para: This member is not meaningful for this control.

remarks.para: The property is not meaningful for this control, although you can change its value and handle the event to detect the change.

summary.para: Occurs when the value of the property changes.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool BeginEdit (System.Windows.Forms.DataGridColumnStyle gridColumn, int rowNumber);

remarks.para: The grid will deny edit requests if the user already started typing into a cell. In that case, the method will return false.

summary.para: Attempts to put the grid into a state where editing is allowed.

returns.para: true if the method is successful; otherwise, false.

Docs.param: A to edit.
The number of the row to edit.

remarks.para: The Visual Studio design environment uses this method to start the initialization of a component that is used on a form or used by another component. The method ends the initialization. Using the and methods prevents the control from being used before it is fully initialized.

summary.para: Begins the initialization of a that is used on a form or used by another component. The initialization occurs at run time.
Gets or sets the grid's border style.

remarks.para: Possible values include None, FixedSingle, and Fixed3D.

summary.para: Occurs when the has changed.
Cancels the current edit operation and rolls back all changes.
Gets or sets the background color of the caption area.

remarks.para: A encapsulates a Windows font and provides the methods for manipulating that font.

summary.para: Gets or sets the font of the grid's caption.
Gets or sets the foreground color of the caption area.
Gets or sets the text of the grid's window caption.

remarks.para: If is false, the Back button, ParentRow button, and caption will not be seen. Because navigation is limited, links to child tables will also not be visible and will be set to None.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the grid's caption is visible.

remarks.para: For more information about handling events, see [<topic://cpconEventsOverview>].

summary.para: Occurs when the property has changed.

remarks.para: Use the method to determine if a row is expanded.

summary.para: Collapses child relations, if any exist for all rows, or for a specified row.

Docs.param: The number of the row to collapse. If set to -1, all rows are collapsed.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the column headers of a table are visible.

remarks.para: When called, the method enables the control to show a pencil in the row header.

summary.para: Informs the control when the user begins to edit the column at the specified location.

Docs.param: The that defines the location of the edited column.

remarks.para: When called, the method enables the control to show a pencil in the row header.

summary.para: Informs the control when the user begins to edit a column using the specified control.

Docs.param: The used to edit the column.

remarks.para: Derived classes should not call the base class's method.
Only the following properties of the should be set:
All other properties are handled by the itself.

summary.para: Constructs a new instance of the accessibility object for this control.

returns.para: The for this control.

summary.para: Creates a new with the specified .

returns.para: The new .

Docs.param: The to use for creating the grid column style.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual System.Windows.Forms.DataGridColumnStyle CreateGridColumn (System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor prop, bool isDefault);

summary.para: Creates a using the specified .

returns.para: The new .

Docs.param: The to use for creating the grid column style.
true to set the column style as the default; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: Setting the property will cause the grid to scroll and show the cell if it is not already visible.

summary.para: Gets or sets which cell has the focus. Not available at design time.

remarks.para: To determine the current cell, use the property.
For more information about handling events, see [<topic://cpconEventsOverview>].

summary.para: Occurs when the property has changed.

remarks.para: Setting the property to a value other than its current value scrolls the control so that the specified row is in view.

The property enables you to iterate through a parent table's rows even if you are viewing the child table rows. For example, if you are viewing a child table, incrementing the will cause the to display the next set of records in the child table that are linked to the parent table.
If the user is viewing a parent table, or a table with no child relations, then the property returns the zero-based index of the current row.

summary.para: Gets or sets index of the row that currently has focus.

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Windows.Forms.Cursor Cursor { set; get; }

summary.para: This member is not meaningful for this control.

remarks.para: The property is not meaningful for this control, although you can change its value and handle the event to detect the change.

summary.para: Occurs when the value of the property changes.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.ComponentModel.Editor("System.Windows.Forms.Design.DataMemberListEditor, System.Design, Version=2.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a", "System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor, System.Drawing, Version=2.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")

remarks.para: If a contains multiple sources of data, you should set the to one of the sources. For example, if the is a or that contains three tables named Customers, Orders, and OrderDetails, you must specify one of the tables to bind to. If the or contains only one , you should set the to the of that .

If the is set to a that contains objects, parent tables will appear with a plus sign (+) in each row header. Clicking the plus sign causes a node to appear that contains links to child tables. For example, if a contains two objects named Customers and Orders, setting the to the Customers table causes the to display a parent table with a plus sign visible on each row header. If the is set to Orders, however, the row headers will be blank.
If the is a , , collection, or array, setting the property throws an exception.

block.para: At run time, you must use the method to reset the property. However, the property alone can be reset at any time to a valid table name.

summary.para: Gets or sets the specific list in a for which the control displays a grid.

remarks.para: At run time, use the method to set the and properties.
The following data sources are valid:

item.para: Any component that implements the interface
Any component that implements the interface

remarks.para: See the class overview for more information on data sources.

If the reference contains more than one table, you must set the property a string that specifies the table to bind to. For example, if the is a or that contains three tables named Customers, Orders, and OrderDetails, you must specify the table to bind to.
Setting the to an object that does not implement the interface or an will cause the grid to throw an exception.
You can create a grid that enables users to edit data but prevents them from adding new rows by using a as the data source and setting the property to false.

To bind the to a strongly typed array of objects, the object type must contain public properties. To create a that displays the array, set the property to where is replaced by the name of the object type. Also note that the property is case-sensitive; the type name must be matched exactly. See the property for an example.

You can also bind the to an . A feature of the is that it can contain objects of multiple types, but the can only bind to such a list when all items in the list are of the same type as the first item. This means that all objects must either be of the same type, or they must inherit from the same class as the first item in the list. For example, if the first item in a list is a , the second item could be a (which inherits from ). If, on the other hand, the first item is a , the second object cannot be a . Further, the must have items in it when it is bound. An empty will result in an empty grid. In addition, the objects in the must contain public properties. When binding to an , set the of the to "ArrayList" (the type name).

summary.para: Gets or sets the data source that the grid is displaying data for.

remarks.para: The event occurs when the value changes, or when the of the changes.
For more information about handling events, see [<topic://cpconEventsOverview>].

summary.para: Occurs when the property value has changed.
Gets the default size of the control.

remarks.para: Call when you are finished using the . The method leaves the in an unusable state. After calling , you must release all references to the so the memory it was occupying can be reclaimed by garbage collection.

summary.para: Disposes of the resources (other than memory) used by the .

Docs.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool EndEdit (System.Windows.Forms.DataGridColumnStyle gridColumn, int rowNumber, bool shouldAbort);

remarks.para: The method returns false if the user is not editing (typing into) a cell.

summary.para: Requests an end to an edit operation taking place on the control.

returns.para: true if the editing operation ceases; otherwise, false.

Docs.param: The to cease editing.
The number of the row to cease editing.
Set to true if the current operation should be stopped.

remarks.para: The Visual Studio design environment uses this method to end the initialization of a component that is used on a form or used by another component. The method starts the initialization. Using the and methods prevents the control from being used before it is fully initialized.

summary.para: Ends the initialization of a that is used on a form or used by another component. The initialization occurs at run time.
Displays child relations, if any exist, for all rows or a specific row.

Docs.param: The number of the row to expand. If set to -1, all rows are expanded.

remarks.para: A column is considered visible even if it is partially concealed.
If a particular column is not visible, set the property to the cell that should be visible.

summary.para: Gets the index of the first visible column in a grid.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the grid displays in flat mode.

remarks.para: For more information about handling events, see [<topic://cpconEventsOverview>].

remarks.para: You typically use this method only if you are either creating a designer for the , or creating your own control incorporating the .

summary.para: Gets or sets the font used for column headers.
Gets or sets the foreground color of headers.

remarks.para: The , in conjunction with the method of the control, is used to determine which part of a control the user has clicked. The contains the row, column, and part of the grid that was clicked. Additionally, the property returns a enumeration.
The method takes an x and y argument supplied by the control's , , , , , and events.

summary.para: Gets information, such as row and column number of a clicked point on the grid, about the grid using a specific .

returns.para: A that contains specific information about the grid.

Docs.param: A that represents single x,y coordinate.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid.HitTestInfo HitTest (int x, int y);

remarks.para: The , in conjunction with the method of the control, is used to determine which part of a control the user has clicked. The contains the row, column, and part of the grid that was clicked. Additionally, the property returns a enumeration.
The method takes an x and y argument supplied by the control's , , , , , and events.

summary.para: Gets information, such as row and column number of a clicked point on the grid, using the x and y coordinate passed to the method.

returns.para: A that contains information about the clicked part of the grid.

Docs.param: The horizontal position of the coordinate.
The vertical position of the coordinate.

summary.para: Gets the horizontal scroll bar for the grid.
Gets a value that indicates whether the node of a specified row is expanded or collapsed.

returns.para: true if the node is expanded; otherwise, false.

Docs.param: The number of the row in question.

remarks.para: Use this method with the , , and methods to manipulate the selection state of a particular row.

summary.para: Gets a value indicating whether a specified row is selected.

returns.para: true if the row is selected; otherwise, false.

Docs.param: The number of the row you are interested in.

summary.para: Occurs when the property value changes.

remarks.para: Set this property before resetting the and properties (either separately, or through the method), or the property will have no effect.
The property cannot be set to a value less than 0.

summary.para: Gets or sets the default width of the grid columns in pixels.

remarks.para: Set this property before resetting the and properties (either separately, or through the method), or the property will have no effect.

summary.para: Gets or sets the preferred row height for the control.

remarks.para: The method overrides the method to implement keyboard navigation of the grid.

returns.para: true, the key should be processed; otherwise, false.

Docs.param: A that contains data about the pressed key.

summary.para: Processes keys for grid navigation.

returns.para: true, if the key was processed; otherwise false.

Docs.param: A that contains data about the key up or key down event.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override bool ProcessKeyPreview (ref System.Windows.Forms.Message m);

Docs.param: To be added.

summary.para: Gets a value indicating whether the Tab key should be processed.

returns.para: true if the TAB key should be processed; otherwise, false.

Docs.param: A that contains data about which the pressed key.

remarks.para: In read-only mode, the grid can be scrolled, nodes can be expanded or collapsed, and so on. However, no additions, edits, or deletes can take place.
The also has a property that can be set to true to prevent data from being edited, on a column-by-column basis.

The can be set to true if you want to prohibit the user from editing the data directly in the . For example, you might want to let users to see all columns in a table, but allow them to edit specific fields only through controls on a different form.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the grid is in read-only mode.

remarks.para: For more information about handling events, see [<topic://cpconEventsOverview>].

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetDataBinding (object dataSource, string dataMember);

remarks.para: You must use the method at run time to reset the property.
See the property for more details about setting a valid data source.

You can create a grid that enables users to edit data but prevents them from adding new rows by using a as the data source and setting the property to false. When the is a or , set the to an empty string ("").

summary.para: Sets the and properties at run time.

Docs.param: The data source for the control.
The string that specifies the table to bind to within the object returned by the property.

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.ComponentModel.ISite Site { set; get; }

summary.para: Adds or removes the objects from the container that is associated with the .

Docs.param: true to add the objects to a container; false to remove them.

remarks.para: Use the retrieved through the property to create customized views of each table displayed by the control.
By default, the collection returned by property does not contain any objects. To create a set of customized views:

item.para: Set the of the grid table object to the of the .
Add objects, one for each grid column you want to show, to the returned by the property.
Set the of each to the of a .
Add the object to the collection returned by property.

block.para: Always create objects and add them to the before adding objects to the . When you add an empty with a valid value to the collection, objects are automatically generated for you. Consequently, an exception will be thrown if you try to add new objects with duplicate values to the .

summary.para: Gets the collection of objects for the grid.

MemberSignature.Value: public override string Text { set; get; }

summary.para: This member is not meaningful for this control.

remarks.para: The property is not meaningful for this control, although you can change its value and handle the event to detect the change.

summary.para: Occurs when the value of the property changes.

remarks.para: Use this method with the , , and methods to manipulate the selection state of a particular row.

summary.para: Unselects a specified row.

Docs.param: The index of the row to deselect.

summary.para: Gets the vertical scroll bar of the control.

remarks.para: The number of visible columns can change depending on their width. For example, if a default width for all columns is set, but the width of a new column is set twice as large, the number of visible columns can be reduced by at least one.

summary.para: Gets the number of visible columns.

remarks.para: The number of visible rows can be changed at run time if the user is allowed to resize the control.

summary.para: Gets the number of rows visible.
